conflictDescription: The developer wants to update the consent module remotely without asking users, but the older adult wants to block all data sharing strictly, which means no data sharing or changes without consent. These goals cannot be true at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow remote update of the consent module without user permission
Block all personal data sharing with doctors
Allow remote update of the consent module without user permission
Block all personal data sharing with family
Allow remote update of the consent module without user permission
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to update ALFREDâ€™s consent module remotely without asking users, so I can keep control and make sure privacy rules are followed.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, to keep my privacy fully safe.
resolutionDescription: The developer agrees to request user consent before any remote update to the consent module. The older adult allows data sharing only after explicit consent is given. This way, privacy is protected and updates are possible.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to update the consent module remotely only after user consent, so I can keep privacy rules updated and respected.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Request user consent before remote updates to consent module
Ensure updates comply with latest privacy rules
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing unless I give consent, so my privacy is fully protected.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Block data sharing without explicit user consent
Require consent for sharing data with doctors, family, or others

conflictDescription: The developer wants ALFRED to enforce consent rules strictly, allowing caregiver tasks only when consent is given, but the older adult wants to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family. These goals cannot be met at the same time because caregiver tasks require data sharing with caregivers, which the older adult forbids.
conflictingNfrPairs: Enforce all consent rules without exceptions
Block all personal data sharing with doctors
Enforce all consent rules without exceptions
Block all personal data sharing with family
Prevent caregiver tasks if consent is not given
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
Ensure caregiver tasks always follow consent rules

userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to enforce consent rules strictly without exceptions, so caregiver tasks are always done right.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, to keep my privacy fully safe.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to balance strict consent enforcement with the older adult's privacy control, allowing data sharing only with explicit consent for necessary caregiver tasks.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to enforce consent rules strictly for caregiver tasks, so tasks happen only with user permission.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Enforce consent rules before any caregiver data access
Allow caregiver tasks only with explicit user consent
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control data sharing so that my privacy is protected and my care needs are met.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Block all data sharing without user consent
Allow data sharing with caregivers only when consent is given
